column4: Is there a way to do an upgrade from Live CD? The reason I am asking is because my brother has 9.04 installed on his laptop. He went to start the other day and after the grub menu he just got lines across the screen and couldn't do anything. I've been working on this for 3 days
look for a guide on Google on how to reinstall Grub from the Ubuntu live CD
but why would I need to reinstall grub?
it is usually the easiest solution for filesystem problems like that. What kind of errors do you see after Grub?
no errors. You just start seeing these lines across the screen, and what looks like chinese writing across the top. I can't even Alt f2 to get a terminal
if you think that reinstalling the grub may help I'll try it
that doesn't sound good at all. Can you access the drives through a live CD?
yes
Good, then it is probably not a disk problem.
Reinstalling Grub is probably your easiest option then, instead of tinkering with the Grub (2?) configuration files.
I checked memory too, it's all good
he's running 9.04 on the laptop because in 9.10 his keyboard and mouse disabled
that is strange. You could try the 10.04 beta and see if that solves it.
That is what I was going to do. I think I'll try reinstalling the grub first.
Thank you for the info. That's why I love Ubuntu and this forum!
No problem. :)

I found a guide to reinstalling grub. One of the things I have to type in is the hard drive, but they want it like hd0,6 or whatever your hard drive is. I know it's sda4 but how do I know how to translate it to the hd0 number?
you can see it in any partitioning tool, try gparted.
Thanks again!
I successfully reinstalled grub but that didn't do it. I think I'll just backup the files and do a reinstall for him.
unfortunate. Good luck.
it was worth a try, and at least I know how to reinstall grub if I had to : )
that's always good :P.
Thank you again for your help
